revision.text:
{{distinguish|Yuri's Day (disambiguation)}} {{Infobox recurring event |logo =Yuri%27s_Night_logo.png |logo_caption =Yuri's Night 'Yurihead' logo |location =International |date =April 12 |frequency =Annually |first = April 12, 2001 |genre = [[Space exploration]] |website = {{url|yurisnight.net}} |footnotes=Commemorates flight of [[Vostok 1]] in 1961 }} [[File:Yuri's Night Dance Party 2011.jpg|thumb|Yuri's Night celebration in Virginia]] [[File:Yuri's Night Dancing Science on a Sphere - Yuri's Night at Goddard.jpg|right|thumb|Yuri's Night celebration at [[Goddard Space Flight Center]]]]
'''Yuri's Night''' is an international celebration held every April 12 to commemorate milestones in space exploration.
Yuri's Night is named for the first human to launch into space, [[Yuri Gagarin]], who flew the [[Vostok 1]] spaceship on April 12, 1961. The launch of [[STS-1]], the first [[Space Shuttle]] mission, is also honored, as it was launched 20 years to the day of Vostok 1 on April 12, 1981. In 2011, Yuri's Night was celebrated at over 567 events in 75 countries on 7 continents. <ref name="Yuri's Night - World Space Party">{{cite news |title=Yuri’s Night Event Data |url=https://yurisnight.net/data/ |accessdate=2018-10-13}}</ref>
Yuri's Night is often called the "World Space Party".<ref name=ynguardian>{{cite news |title=Darwin’s Day to Yuri’s Night: some science dates to remember |url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2014/sep/20/festive-science-dates |newspaper=The Guardian |date=2014-09-20 |accessdate=2015-01-17}}</ref>
==Objective==
The goal of Yuri's Night is to increase public interest in [[space exploration]] and to inspire a new generation of explorers. Driven by space-inspired artistic expression and culminating in a worldwide network of annual celebrations and educational events, Yuri's Night creates a global community of young people committed to shaping the future of space exploration while developing responsible leaders and innovators with a global perspective. These global events are a showcase for elements of culture that embrace space including music, dance, fashion, and art.<ref name="AIAA">Ryan Kobrick, R. Brice Russ, and Timothy Bailey (2011). Yuri's Night: Linking the World Together with an International Space Celebration. Retrieved on 2/9/2014 from http://arc.aiaa.org/doi/abs/10.2514/6.2011-5175.</ref>
==History of Yuri's Night==
Yuri's Night was created in 2000 by [[Loretta Hidalgo Whitesides]], [[George T. Whitesides]] and Trish Garner. The first Yuri's Night was held on April 12, 2001, exactly 40 years after the launch of [[Vostok 1]].<ref name=wired20110214/> Since 1962, April 12 has been celebrated in [[Russia]] (formerly the [[Soviet Union]]) as [[Cosmonautics Day]] ({{lang-ru|День Космонавтики}})<ref name="32FZ">{{Cite Russian law |ru_entity=Государственная Дума |ru_type=Федеральный закон |ru_number=32-ФЗ |ru_date=13 марта 1995 г. |ru_title=О днях воинской славы и памятных датах России |ru_effective_date=со дня официального опубликования |ru_published_in="Российская Газета", №52 |ru_published_date=15 марта 1995 г |ru_url={{cite web |url=http://ntc.duma.gov.ru/duma_na/asozd/asozd_text.php?code%3D22479 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=April 21, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120507141556/http://ntc.duma.gov.ru/duma_na/asozd/asozd_text.php?code=22479 |archivedate=May 7, 2012 }} |ru_amendment_type=Федерального закона |ru_amendment_number=59-ФЗ |ru_amendment_date=10 апреля 2009 г |ru_amendment_title=О внесении изменения в статью 1.1 федерального закона "О днях воинской славы и памятных датах России" |en_entity=[[State Duma]] |en_type=Federal Law |en_number=32-FZ |en_date=March 13, 1995 |en_title=On the Days of Military Glory and the Commemorative Dates in Russia |en_effective_date=the day of the official publication |en_url |en_amendment_type=Federal Law |en_amendment_number=59-FZ |en_amendment_date=April 10, 2009 |en_amendment_title=On Amending Article 1.1 of the Federal Law "On the Days of Military Glory and the Commemorative Dates in Russia" }}</ref> and since 2011 internationally as the [[International Day of Human Space Flight]].
The 2004 Yuri's Night event in [[Los Angeles]] was attended by space-related figures including author [[Ray Bradbury]], [[Space tourism|space tourist]] [[Dennis Tito]], [[Ansari X Prize|X-Prize]] founder [[Peter Diamandis]], [[*NSYNC]]'s [[Lance Bass]] and [[Nichelle Nichols]] ([[Uhura]] from the original ''[[Star Trek]]'' series). The event included a large party with 2 dance floors and world-class DJs.<ref name=collectspace>[http://www.collectspace.com/ubb/Forum23/HTML/001097.html "Sci-Fi Legend Ray Bradbury, Mars Rover Team, Young Professionals Celebrate Spaceflight Milestone In Style At Annual Gala"]</ref>
The 2007 event in the San Francisco Bay Area was held at [[NASA]] [[Ames Research Center]] at [[Moffett Field]] in [[Mountain View, CA]]. The event featured artistic installations, technology demonstrations, and DJ music continuing through dawn of the following day.<ref name=laughingsquid>{{cite news |title=Photos of Yuri’s Night Bay Area 2007, A Giant Party at NASA |first=Scott |last=Beale|url=http://laughingsquid.com/photos-of-yuris-night-bay-area-2007-a-giant-party-at-nasa/ |newspaper=[[Laughing Squid]] |date=2007-04-14 |accessdate=2014-02-09}}</ref>
April 2011 marked the 50th anniversary of Gagarin's historic first flight.<ref name=wired20110214> {{cite news |title=Celebrate 50 Years of Human Space Flight on Yuri’s Night |first=Jason Cranford |last=Teague|url=https://www.wired.com/geekdad/2011/02/celebrate-50-years-of-human-space-flight-on-yuris-night/ |newspaper=Wired |date=2011-02-14 |accessdate=2011-04-04}}</ref> Over 100,000 people attended 567 Yuri's Night parties in 75 countries,<ref name=aboutyn>[https://yurisnight.net/about/ About Yuri's Night]</ref> and the crew of [[Expedition 27]] recorded a Yuri's Night celebratory greeting from the [[International Space Station]].<ref name=ynISS>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H6BThA641Rg Yuri's Night 2011 International Space Station Crew: 50th Anniversary of Human Spaceflight (YouTube)]</ref>
==Yuri's Night today==
Yuri's Night events "combine space-themed partying with education and outreach". Parties and events are held at [[List of NASA Visitor Centers|NASA centers]], museums, schools, bars, houses, and other locations.<ref name=aboutyn />
Yuri's Night has been celebrated in locations including [[Los Angeles, California|Los Angeles]] [http://www.nbclosangeles.com/the-scene/events/Yuris-Night-119724669.html], the [[San Francisco Bay Area]] [https://www.flickr.com/photos/cameravox/sets/72157604516260066/], [[Huntsville, Alabama]] [https://web.archive.org/web/20130227025727/http://www.yurisnighthsv.org/yuri.shtml], [[New Orleans]] [https://web.archive.org/web/20130525135725/http://live.yurisnight.net/yuriss-night-new-orleans-louisiana], [[Inverness]] [https://web.archive.org/web/20130525134537/http://live.yurisnight.net/20-pictures-for-you-from-yuris-event-in-inver], [[Stockholm]], [[Tel Aviv]], [[Tokyo]], [[Lisbon]] [http://www.esa.int/esaMI/Gagarin/SEMPIB6UPLG_0.html], [[Helsinki]] [http://meridiaani.org/index.php/yuri-s-night] [[Afghanistan]], [[Latvia]] [https://web.archive.org/web/20130525135904/http://live.yurisnight.net/hi-from-latvia], [[Romania]], [[Peru]], [[Antarctica]], and the [[International Space Station]] [https://web.archive.org/web/20120413052043/http://cosmiclog.msnbc.msn.com/_news/2012/04/03/11007876-feeling-down-about-spaceflight-lift-your-spirits-with-yuris-night], in addition to many other locations and virtual online celebrations [http://yurisnight.net/partylist/].
Yuri's Night is organized on a global level by an all-volunteer "Executive Team",<ref name=globalteam>[https://yurisnight.net/about/thehumans/ Yuri's Night Executive Team]</ref> which provides logistical and promotional support to Yuri's Night events worldwide. Individual organizers are responsible for registering and running their local events.{{cn|date=April 2018}}
==See also== * [[World Space Week]] * [[TMRO]]
== References == {{Reflist|30em}}
== External links == {{Commons category}} * [http://www.yurisnight.net/ Yuri's Night] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20120413052043/http://cosmiclog.msnbc.msn.com/_news/2012/04/03/11007876-feeling-down-about-spaceflight-lift-your-spirits-with-yuris-night MSNBC: Feeling down about spaceflight? Lift your spirits with Yuri's Night] * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3wjgu-PDTkA No Borders - Bridging Cultures Through Yuri's Night] video of the presentation during the [[International Astronautical Congress|IAC 2013]] ([[YouTube]])

{{Infobox martial artist | name = Zack Mwekassa | image = | other_names = The Black Warrior | nationality = [[Democratic Republic of the Congo|Congolese]] | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1984|1|20}} | birth_place = [[Kinshasa, Congo]] | fighting_out_of = [[Johannesburg]], [[Gauteng]], [[South Africa]] | height = {{convert|1.83|m|ftin|abbr=on}} | weight_kg = 95 | weight_class = [[Cruiserweight (boxing)|Cruiserweight]] (boxing)
[[Heavyweight]] (kickboxing) | style = [[Boxing]] | stance = orthodox | reach_in = | team = | years_active = 2006 – present (boxing)
2014 – present (kickboxing) | box_win = 15 | box_kowin = 14 | box_loss = 4 | box_koloss = 3 | box_draw = 0 | kbox_nc = 0 | kickbox_win = 15 | kickbox_kowin = 13 | kickbox_loss = 4 | kickbox_koloss = 2 | kickbox_draw = | kickbox_nc = | mma_kowin = | mma_subwin = | mma_koloss = | mma_subloss = | mma_draw = | mma_nc = | boxrec = 357978 | sherdog = | relatives = | updated = 19 September 2015 }} '''Zack Mwekassa''' (born 20 January 1984) is a [[Democratic Republic of the Congo|Congolese]] [[boxing|boxer]] and [[Kickboxing|kickboxer]] who fights in [[Glory (kickboxing)|GLORY]]. he is a former Interim [[Glory (kickboxing)#Glory Light Heavyweight Championship|Glory Light Heavyweight Champion]] As of 1 October 2017, he is ranked the #4 light-heavyweight in the world by CombatPress.com.{{cite web|url=http://combatpress.com/2017/10/combat-press-kickboxing-rankings-october-2017/|title=Combat Press Kickboxing Rankings: October 2017|work=combatpress.com}} ==Biography== Mwekassa is the son of a chemist and his two brothers are lawyers. In addition to his fighting career, he is trained as a computer network engineer. He and his family were displaced from their native [[Democratic Republic of the Congo|Congo]] during the [[Second Congo War]] that began in 1998.{{cite web|url=http://www.bloodyelbow.com/2014/5/2/5675474/mwekassa-i-come-from-a-land-of-war|title=Zack Mwekassa: 'I come from a land of war'|publisher=bloodyelbow.com |author=John Joe O'Regan|date=2014-05-02|accessdate=2014-05-04}} ==Career== ===Boxing=== Mwekassa began his professional boxing career at the age of 22 in 2006 in [[South Africa]]. In the first 2 years of his career, he amassed an undefeated streak of 8-0 with all but one of the wins coming by way of TKO or KO. He experienced his first losses back-to-back in 2008 and 2009, before going on another 5-0 undefeated streak. ===Kickboxing=== Mwekassa began training in [[South Africa]] in 2003 with elite kickboxers, including the late [[Mike Bernardo]]. His trainers intended him for the [[K-1]] circuit but the opportunities were scarce, so he moved into professional boxing in 2006. In 2014, Mwekassa resurrected his interest in kickboxing. He saw [[Glory (kickboxing)|GLORY]] on television and approached the company about fighting for them. He soon found himself scheduled to face popular MMA and kickboxing fighter [[Pat Barry (fighter)|Pat Barry]] at [[Glory 16: Denver]]. In what many considered a shocking upset, he knocked out Barry with an incredible uppercut in the first round. Mwekassa returned to the Glory ring on November 7, 2014 at [[Glory 18: Oklahoma]]. He was part of a four-man, one-night tournament to decide the next Light Heavyweight title contender. Mwekassa started in impressive fashion as he knocked out Brian Collette in the semifinals. In the finals, he faced [[Saulo Cavalari]]. After a competitive back-and-forth two rounds, Mwekassa lost in the third round due to a head kick. Mwekassa had a rematch with Cavalari for the vacant Glory Light Heavyweight Championship at [[Bellator MMA & Glory: Dynamite 1]] on September 19, 2015.{{cite web|url=http://www.mmamania.com/2015/7/30/9074967/bellator-142-dynamite-fight-card-zack-mwekassa-vs-saulo-cavalari-rematch-glory-lkickboxing|title=Bellator 142: 'Dynamite' fight card gets Zack Mwekassa vs Saulo Cavalari rematch for vacant GLORY light heavyweight title|publisher=mmamania.com|author=Michael Stets|date=2015-07-30|accessdate=2015-08-06}} He lost the fight via unanimous decision. == Titles == *WBF International Cruiserweight Title *ABU all Africa heavyweight title *Interim [[Glory (kickboxing)#Glory Light Heavyweight Championship|Glory Light Heavyweight Championship]] (1 time) == Boxing record == {{BoxingRecordSummary |draws= |nc= |ko-wins=14 |ko-losses=3 |dec-wins= |dec-losses=1 |dq-wins=1 |dq-losses= }} {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:95%" |- !Date !Result !Opponent !Location !Type !Round !Time !Record |- align="center" bgcolor="#CCFFCC" | 2014-06-28 ||Win ||align=left|{{flagicon|Kenya}} Bernard Adie|| [[Kinshasa]], DR Congo || TKO || 5 || 1:20 || 15-4-0 |- |- align="center" bgcolor="#FFBBBB" | 2013-11-30 || Loss ||align=left|{{flagicon|RUS}} [[Dmitry Kudryashov (boxer)|Dmitry Kudryashov]] || [[Lyubertsy]], Russia || KO || 1 || 0:50 || 14-4-0 |- |- align="center" bgcolor="#CCFFCC" | 2013-05-31 || Win ||align=left|{{flagicon|DRC}} Mugabon Mudimba || [[Cape Town, South Africa]] || KO || 5 || N/A || 14-3-0 |- |- align="center" bgcolor="#FFBBBB" | 2012-9-22 || Loss ||align=left|{{flagicon|South Africa}} Danie Venter || [[Gauteng]], [[South Africa]] || TKO || 4 || 2:23 || 13-3-0 |- |- align="center" bgcolor="#CCFFCC" | 2012-06-16 || Win ||align=left|{{flagicon|South Africa}} Tshepang Mohale || [[Gauteng]], [[South Africa]] || TKO || 1 || 1:21 || 13-2-0 |- |- align="center" bgcolor="#CCFFCC" | 2011-11-23 || Win ||align=left|{{flagicon|DRC}} Kizito Ruhamnye || [[Gauteng]], South [[Africa]] || KO || 1 || 2:59 || 12-2-0 |- |- align="center" bgcolor="#CCFFCC" | 2011-09-24 || Win
